Contributor: United States Food Administration, publisher.; Edwards & Deutsch Litho. Co., lithographer.;
Note: Date based on America's participation in the war. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Text quotes President Lincoln who says that charity is for all and  the nation should do whatever it takes to achieve and cherish a just peace. It's important to save food for world relief. Illustration is a portrait of Lincoln.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.
Subject: Food conservation -- United States.; World War, 1914-1918 -- Propaganda.; War posters, American.;

Title: Lincoln said
